page.title: 11EDUCATION IN STAMBOURNE 1
page.content: There are no schools in Stambourne. The village school closed in 1953. There are about 35 children of school age in the village. Those aged 5-11 attend St. Margaret's, Toppesfield, 2-3 miles away. They travel by contract bus; under- sevens living more than 1.5 miles from the school, and under-elevens more than 2 miles, can travel free. The school has about 60 pupils and 3 teachers. Over-elevens attend Hedingham School, a comprehensive with 1100 pupils and 63 teachers. The school is 6 miles away, so all Stambourne's pupils qualify for free transport. Children either take a packed lunch or buy a lunch provided by the school meals service. Some children (eg.from single-parent families) receive free meals.
